00009 // Public interface for stripifier
00011 
00012 //GeForce1 and 2 cache size
00013 #define CACHESIZE_GEFORCE1_2 16
00014 
00015 //GeForce3 cache size
00016 #define CACHESIZE_GEFORCE3   24
00017 
00018 enum PrimType
00019 {
00020         PT_LIST,
00021         PT_STRIP,
00022         PT_FAN
00023 };
00024 
00025 struct PrimitiveGroup
00026 {
00027         PrimType type;
00028         unsigned int numIndices;
00029         unsigned short* indices;
00030 
00032 
00033         PrimitiveGroup() : type( PT_STRIP ), numIndices( 0 ), indices( NULL ) {}
00034         ~PrimitiveGroup()
00035         {
00036                 if( indices )
00037                         delete[] indices;
00038                 indices = NULL;
00039         }
00040 };

00042 
00044 // EnableRestart()
00045 //
00046 // For GPUs that support primitive restart, this sets a value as the restart index
00047 //
00048 // Restart is meaningless if strips are not being stitched together, so enabling restart
00049 //  makes NvTriStrip forcing stitching.  So, you'll get back one strip.
00050 //
00051 // Default value: disabled
00052 //
00053 void EnableRestart( const unsigned int restartVal );
00054 
00056 // DisableRestart()
00057 //
00058 // For GPUs that support primitive restart, this disables using primitive restart
00059 //
00060 void DisableRestart();
00061 
00062 
00064 // SetCacheSize()
00065 //
00066 // Sets the cache size which the stripfier uses to optimize the data.
00067 // Controls the length of the generated individual strips.
00068 // This is the "actual" cache size, so 24 for GeForce3 and 16 for GeForce1/2
00069 // You may want to play around with this number to tweak performance.
00070 //
00071 // Default value: 16
00072 //
00073 void SetCacheSize( const unsigned int cacheSize );
00074 
00075 
00077 // SetStitchStrips()
00078 //
00079 // bool to indicate whether to stitch together strips into one huge strip or not.
00080 // If set to true, you'll get back one huge strip stitched together using degenerate
00081 //  triangles.
00082 // If set to false, you'll get back a large number of separate strips.
00083 //
00084 // Default value: true
00085 //
00086 void SetStitchStrips( const bool bStitchStrips );
00087 
00088 
00090 // SetMinStripSize()
00091 //
00092 // Sets the minimum acceptable size for a strip, in triangles.
00093 // All strips generated which are shorter than this will be thrown into one big, separate list.
00094 //
00095 // Default value: 0
00096 //
00097 void SetMinStripSize( const unsigned int minSize );
00098 
00099 
00101 // SetListsOnly()
00102 //
00103 // If set to true, will return an optimized list, with no strips at all.
00104 //
00105 // Default value: false
00106 //
00107 void SetListsOnly( const bool bListsOnly );
00108 
00109 
00111 // GenerateStrips()
00112 //
00113 // in_indices: input index list, the indices you would use to render
00114 // in_numIndices: number of entries in in_indices
00115 // primGroups: array of optimized/stripified PrimitiveGroups
00116 // numGroups: number of groups returned
00117 //
00118 // Be sure to call delete[] on the returned primGroups to avoid leaking mem
00119 //
00120 bool GenerateStrips( const unsigned short* in_indices, const unsigned int in_numIndices,
00121                                         PrimitiveGroup** primGroups, unsigned short* numGroups, bool validateEnabled = false );
00122 
00123 
00125 // RemapIndices()
00126 //
00127 // Function to remap your indices to improve spatial locality in your vertex buffer.
00128 //
00129 // in_primGroups: array of PrimitiveGroups you want remapped
00130 // numGroups: number of entries in in_primGroups
00131 // numVerts: number of vertices in your vertex buffer, also can be thought of as the range
00132 //  of acceptable values for indices in your primitive groups.
00133 // remappedGroups: array of remapped PrimitiveGroups
00134 //
00135 // Note that, according to the remapping handed back to you, you must reorder your 
00136 //  vertex buffer.
00137 //
00138 // Credit goes to the MS Xbox crew for the idea for this interface.
00139 //
00140 void RemapIndices( const PrimitiveGroup* in_primGroups, const unsigned short numGroups, 
00141                                   const unsigned short numVerts, PrimitiveGroup** remappedGroups );
